results.title: Acute Esophageal Necrosis as a Rare Complication of Metabolic Acidosis in a Diabetic Patient: A Case Report
results.text_hl: A 61-year-old man with history of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes mellitus@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Canagliflozin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068896 @@@canagliflozin@@@, @CHEMICAL_glimepiride @CHEMICAL_MESH:C057619 @@@glimepiride@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Pioglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077205 @@@pioglitazone@@@ came to our attention with persistent @DISEASE_Vomiting @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@, odynophagia, @<m>DISEASE_Chest_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@ after each meal, and progressive @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@.

citations.NLM: Greco S, Giovine A, Rocchi C, Resca R, Bigoni R, Formigaro L, Angeletti AG, Fabbri N, Bonazza A, Feo CV. Acute Esophageal Necrosis as a Rare Complication of Metabolic Acidosis in a Diabetic Patient: A Case Report Am J Case Rep. 2023 Aug 15;24():e939624. PMID: 37580902
citations.BibTeX: @article{37580902, title={Acute Esophageal Necrosis as a Rare Complication of Metabolic Acidosis in a Diabetic Patient: A Case Report}, author={Greco S and Giovine A and Rocchi C and Resca R and Bigoni R and Formigaro L and Angeletti AG and Fabbri N and Bonazza A and Feo CV}, journal={Am J Case Rep}, volume={24}, pages={e939624}}

results.title: A 39-Year-Old Man With Diabetes, Pleuritic Chest Pain, and Multiple Cavitary Lung Nodules.
results.text_hl: A 39-Year-Old Man With @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@Diabetes@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Chest_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@Pleuritic Chest Pain@@@, and Multiple @DISEASE_Solitary_Pulmonary_Nodule @DISEASE_MESH:D003074 @@@Cavitary Lung Nodules@@@.

results.title: Metformin loaded non-ionic surfactant vesicles: optimization of formulation, effect of process variables and characterization
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ an oral hypoglycemic has been widely used as a fist line of treatment of @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@Type II Diabetes@@@ but in a very high dose 2-3 times a day and moreover suffers from a number of side effects like @DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@, @DISEASE_Stomach_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D013272 @@@gastric discomfort@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Chest_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@, @DISEASE_Drug_Hypersensitivity @DISEASE_MESH:D004342 @@@allergic reactions@@@ being some of them.

citations.NLM: Sankhyan A, Pawar PK. Metformin loaded non-ionic surfactant vesicles: optimization of formulation, effect of process variables and characterization Daru. 2013 Jan 11;21(1):7. PMID: 23351604
citations.BibTeX: @article{23351604, title={Metformin loaded non-ionic surfactant vesicles: optimization of formulation, effect of process variables and characterization}, author={Sankhyan A and Pawar PK}, journal={Daru}, volume={21}, number={1}, pages={7}}

results.title: Effects of metformin on microvascular function and exercise tolerance in women with angina and normal coronary arteries: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ may improve vascular function and decrease @DISEASE_Myocardial_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D017202 @@@myocardial ischemia@@@ in nondiabetic @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Chest_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@ and angiographically normal coronary arteries.

citations.NLM: Jadhav S, Ferrell W, Greer IA, Petrie JR, Cobbe SM, Sattar N. Effects of metformin on microvascular function and exercise tolerance in women with angina and normal coronary arteries: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2006 Sep 5;48(5):956-63. PMID: 16949486
citations.BibTeX: @article{16949486, title={Effects of metformin on microvascular function and exercise tolerance in women with angina and normal coronary arteries: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study.}, author={Jadhav S and Ferrell W and Greer IA and Petrie JR and Cobbe SM and Sattar N}, journal={J Am Coll Cardiol}, volume={48}, number={5}, pages={956-63}}

results.title: Insulin-sensitizing antihyperglycaemic medications are associated with better outcome in patients with diabetes undergoing cardiac stress testing.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Of 417 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ referred to stress testing for evaluation of @<m>DISEASE_Chest_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@, 222 were identified as being treated with conventional therapy only (@GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ and @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ secretagogues) and 195 as being treated with @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ sensitizers (@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Thiazolidinediones @CHEMICAL_MESH:D045162 @@@thiazolidinediones@@@ (TZD)).

citations.NLM: Kapinya K, Nijjar PS, Stanek M, Amanullah A. Insulin-sensitizing antihyperglycaemic medications are associated with better outcome in patients with diabetes undergoing cardiac stress testing. Intern Med J. 2008 Apr;38(4):259-64. PMID: 17725610
citations.BibTeX: @article{17725610, title={Insulin-sensitizing antihyperglycaemic medications are associated with better outcome in patients with diabetes undergoing cardiac stress testing.}, author={Kapinya K and Nijjar PS and Stanek M and Amanullah A}, journal={Intern Med J}, volume={38}, number={4}, pages={259-64}}

results.title: [Management of hyperglycemia in the non-critical hospitalized patients with oral feeding].
results.text_hl: A 67-year-old @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ with a history of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, @DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@ and 6 years of evolution of @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes mellitus@@@ presented with @DISEASE_Fever @DISEASE_MESH:D005334 @@@fever@@@, @DISEASE_Conjunctivitis_Bacterial @DISEASE_MESH:D003234 @@@purulent sputum@@@ and right @<m>DISEASE_Chest_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@. She was on treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ 850 mg/bid, @CHEMICAL_glimepiride @CHEMICAL_MESH:C057619 @@@glimepiride@@@ 4 mg/day, @CHEMICAL_candesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C081643 @@@candesartan@@@ 16 mg/day, @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ 10mg/day and @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@acetylsalicylic acid@@@ 100mg/day.

citations.NLM: Jansen S, Buonaiuto V, Márquez-Gómez I, Gómez-Huelgas R. [Management of hyperglycemia in the non-critical hospitalized patients with oral feeding]. Rev Clin Esp. 2012 Feb;212(2):84-9. PMID: 21798530
citations.BibTeX: @article{21798530, title={[Management of hyperglycemia in the non-critical hospitalized patients with oral feeding].}, author={Jansen S and Buonaiuto V and Márquez-Gómez I and Gómez-Huelgas R}, journal={Rev Clin Esp}, volume={212}, number={2}, pages={84-9}}

results.title: Atypical presentation of a middle age male with severe hypertriglyceridaemia: a case report
results.text_hl: Here we describe a case of 53-year-old white male admitted to the emergency room with acute atypical central @<m>DISEASE_Chest_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@ of 8 hours duration.

citations.NLM: Albahrani AI, Usher J J, Marks E, Ranganath L, Shenkin A. Atypical presentation of a middle age male with severe hypertriglyceridaemia: a case report J Med Case Rep. 2007 Jul 14;1():51. PMID: 17629933
